page.title: 07Farming in the Scalford Area
page.content: The farms in our area are mostly a mixture of arable and livestock. All of the farms have some livestock, mostly dairy cattle.On some farms the only crop grown is grass for making hay and silage.Crops grown on other farms include wheat, barley, potatoes and oil seed rape. The Spring and Summer months are spent tending and harvesting the crops , sorting them and sending them off to be processed into food. Crops for feeding the cattle are kept on the farm ready for use in the Winter. In the Autumn, after clearing and ploughing the land the farmers plant seeds for the early crops next year. Apart from dairy cattle, other animals kept include some sheep and a few pigs.The farmers have to work hard to keep their animals fit.Many animals are taken to be sold at Melton market.
